body_html:
hi @jhseu,

apologies for late reply.
fyi @rxwei - I have succesfully generated grpc wrappers for all tensorflow services in swift.
https://github.com/nubbel/swift-tensorflow/
(there's a script to auto build in different target languages too / java /cpp)

@jhseu - When you asked previously about the api and what was missing - the answer would be everything that's in python and not in the c api. There is a growing interest, I imagine one day swift will supercede python for server side development. maybe swift v5.
#19

My idea when digging into this was one day to sit down and build graphs in swift instead of using python. so having a library as deep as the python api is would be the best.
https://github.com/petewarden/tensorflow_makefile/blob/49c08e4d4ff3b6e7d99374dc2fbf8b358150ef9c/tensorflow/g3doc/api_docs/python/index.md

the grpc / from my reading is like how the c++ library currently works
in that it's mostly for 'control the execution of a graph'
https://github.com/petewarden/tensorflow_makefile/blob/49c08e4d4ff3b6e7d99374dc2fbf8b358150ef9c/tensorflow/g3doc/api_docs/cc/index.md
in that effect / the corresponding swift tensorflow package could do that today (via grpc).

To move forward on original vision - I need to put all the bits of the puzzle together - but alas - it would never completely fulfill my intention of building the graph in swift. From reading into swig / this doesn't have support for swift. swig/swig#981

there's an attempt to auto scaffold swift code from cpp
https://github.com/sandym/swiftpp
but I'm reluctant to dive down that path as the cpp library I believe has parity with only the grpc services.

I guess grpc could find a home with swift and end user if it was wired up to behave like sourcekitten / xcode in that as you type in editor it's executing the code and getting responses from the rpc calls.

I'm enjoying learning about grpc / swift microservices in any case.

A question to ponder - could you do everything in python today if you were using python via grpc (the old adage eating your own dog food comes to mind - but it describes what I need from google to flesh out my swift project)

I'm off to the pub.

body:
hi @jhseu,

apologies for late reply.
fyi @rxwei  - I have succesfully generated  grpc wrappers for all tensorflow services in swift.
https://github.com/nubbel/swift-tensorflow/
(there's a script to auto build in different target languages too / java /cpp)

@jhseu - When you asked previously about the api and what was missing - the answer would be everything that's in python and not in the c api. There is a growing interest, I imagine one day swift will supercede python for server side development. maybe swift v5.
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/19

My idea when digging into this was one day to sit down and build graphs in swift instead of using python.  so having a library as deep as the python api is would be the best.
https://github.com/petewarden/tensorflow_makefile/blob/49c08e4d4ff3b6e7d99374dc2fbf8b358150ef9c/tensorflow/g3doc/api_docs/python/index.md

the grpc / from my reading is like how the c++ library currently works
 in that it's mostly for 'control the execution of a graph'
https://github.com/petewarden/tensorflow_makefile/blob/49c08e4d4ff3b6e7d99374dc2fbf8b358150ef9c/tensorflow/g3doc/api_docs/cc/index.md
in that effect / the corresponding swift tensorflow package could do that today (via grpc).

To move forward on original vision - I need to put all the bits of the puzzle together - but alas - it would never completely fulfill my intention of building the graph in swift. From reading into swig / this doesn't have support for swift. https://github.com/swig/swig/issues/981

there's an attempt to auto scaffold swift code from cpp 
https://github.com/sandym/swiftpp
but I'm reluctant to dive down that path as the cpp library I believe has parity with only the grpc services. 

I guess grpc could find a home with swift and end user if it was wired up to behave like sourcekitten / xcode in that as you type in editor it's executing the code and getting responses from the rpc calls.  

I'm enjoying learning about grpc / swift microservices in any case. 

A question to ponder - could you do everything in python today if you were using python via grpc (the old adage eating your own dog food comes to mind - but it describes what I need from google to flesh out my swift project)

I'm off to the pub.
